intro: Indosasa lingchuanensis, commonly known as the Lingchuan bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
